algorithms.name: agent fingerprint
algorithms.html:
The <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="agent-fingerprint" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">agent fingerprint</dfn> of an agent is computed by following these
steps:

steps.html: Compute the SKPI Fingerprint of the agent certificate according to [RFC7469] using SHA-256 as the hash algorithm.
base64 encode the result of Step 1 according to [RFC4648].

algorithms.name: certificate serial number
algorithms.html:
Let the <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="certificate-serial-number" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">certificate serial number</dfn> be the result of the following
steps:

steps.html: If the agent has never generated an agent certificate:
Let the certificate serial number base be a 128-bit UUID.

Let the <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="certificate-serial-number-counter" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">certificate serial number counter</dfn> be a 32-bit
        unsigned integer, initially set to 0.
Generate a 160-bit value as follows:
Increment the certificate serial number counter by one.
Assign the upper 128 bits to the certificate serial number base.
Assign the lower 32 bits to the certificate serial number counter.

algorithms.name: agent hostname
algorithms.html: Each time the agent changes its DNS-SD Service Instance Name or certificate serial number it must compute an agent hostname as follows.

steps.html: Set base64SerialNumber to the base64 encoded certificate serial number.
Set <var>encodedInstanceName</var> to the result of the following:
Replace any character in the DNS-SD Instance Name other than [A-Za-z0-9-] with a hyphen -.
Set <var>encodedDomain</var> to the result of the following:
Replace any character in the DNS-SD Domain Name other than [A-Za-z0-9-] with a hyphen -.
Set the agent hostname to the string base64SerialNumber + . + encodedInstanceName + . + encodedDomain

algorithms.html: To encode P into a numeric string, follow these steps:

steps.html: Convert P to a base-10 integer N.

If N has fewer than 9 digits:

  • Zero-pad N on the left with 3 - len(N) mod 3 digits.

  • Output N in groups of three digits separated by dashes.

If N has more than 9 digits:

  • Zero-pad N on the left with 4 - len(N) mod 4 digits.

  • Output N in groups of four digits separated by dashes.

algorithms.html: To decode a string N into a PSK P, follow these steps:

steps.html: Remove dashes and leading zeros from N.
Parse N as a base-10 decimal number to obtain P.

algorithms.html: To encode a PSK into a QR code, follow these steps:

steps.html: Set N to the value of P converted to an ASCII-encoded, hexadecimal string.
Construct a text QR code with the value of N.

algorithms.html: To decode a PSK P given a QR code, follow these steps:

steps.html: Obtain the string N by decoding the QR code.
Parse N as a hexadecimal number to obtain P.
